title: Authors and Citation
text: Tavera Cifuentes M, Otero J, Umana J, Montenegro J (2023). ColOpenData: ColOpenData. R package version 0.0.1.
code: @Manual{,   title = {ColOpenData: ColOpenData},   author = {Maria Camila {Tavera Cifuentes} and Julian Otero and Juan D. Umana and Juan F. Montenegro},   year = {2023},   note = {R package version 0.0.1}, }

title: ColOpenData
text: ColOpenData package acquires, standardizes, wrangles Colombian socioeconomic, climate land cover data. solves problem Colombian data issued different web pages formats using functions allow user select desired database download without exhausting acquisition process. Also, allows datasets merged multiple operations, calculating statistics, can made, taking account information different datasets. ColOpenData developed Universidad de Los Andes part Epiverse-TRACE program.

title: ColOpenData
text: can install development version ColOpenData GitHub :

title: ColOpenData
text: example shows retrieve census data department level Colombia including administrative divisions spatial data, later use visualize Dengue cases country 2018. using MGNCNPV_DPTO_2018 dataset, contains National Geo statistical Framework (MGN) National Population Living Census (CNPV) department level 2018. load dataset can use download function follows. downloaded, can subset data regions columns interest. example need departments codes geometries. Dengue cases 2018 can loaded example dataset dengue_2018, previously loaded package. merge datasets use department’s codes. Finally, can visualize cases map.

title: ColOpenData
text: package currently concept, defined RECON software lifecycle. means essential features mechanisms still developed, package ready use outside development team.

title: ColOpenData
text: Contributions welcome via pull requests.

title: ColOpenData
text: Please note ColOpenData project released Contributor Code Conduct. contributing project, agree abide terms.

title: Dengue data 2018 — dengue_2018
text: Count Dengue cases Colombia 2021 grouped department level

title: Dengue data 2018 — dengue_2018
text: data frame 33 rows 2 columns: DPTO_CCDGO Department code CASES Dengue case count

title: Dengue data 2018 — dengue_2018
text: https://epiverse-trace.github.io/sivirep/

title: Download demographic dataset — download_demographic
text: Download demographic named dataset server. data obtained national census 2018.

title: Download demographic dataset — download_demographic
text: dataset dataset code sheet string indicate specific sheet (internal Dataset)

title: Download demographic dataset — download_demographic
text: dataframe downloaded

title: Download geospatial dataset — download_geospatial
text: Download geospatial named dataset server. data merged simplified version National Census, associating census geospatial structure.

text: dataset dataset code

title: Download geospatial dataset — download_geospatial
text: data.frame downloaded data

what: Retrieve weather data from stations in geometry — download_weather
title: Retrieve weather data from stations in geometry — download_weather
text: Retrieve weather stations observed data given geometry.

title: Retrieve weather data from stations in geometry — download_weather
code: download_weather(   geometry,   start_date,   end_date,   frequency,   tags,   group = FALSE )

title: Retrieve weather data from stations in geometry — download_weather
text: geometry sf object containing geometry (polygon multipolygon) start_date starting date format "YYYY-MM-DD" end_date end date format "YYYY-MM-DD" frequency aggregation frequency. Can "day", "week","month" "year" tags character containing tags analyze group TRUE, returns one observation mean stations consulted. Default FALSE

title: Retrieve weather data from stations in geometry — download_weather
text: data.frame observed data given geometry

title: Retrieve weather data from stations in geometry — download_weather

what: Retrieve weather data by municipality name — download_weather_mpio
title: Retrieve weather data by municipality name — download_weather_mpio
text: Retrieve weather stations observed data given municipality.

title: Retrieve weather data by municipality name — download_weather_mpio
code: download_weather_mpio(   name,   start_date,   end_date,   frequency,   tags,   group = FALSE )

title: Retrieve weather data by municipality name — download_weather_mpio
text: name string DIVIPOLA code given municipality start_date starting date format "YYYY-MM-DD" end_date end date format "YYYY-MM-DD" frequency aggregation frequency. Can "day", "week","month" "year" tags character containing tags analyze group TRUE, returns one observation mean stations consulted. Default FALSE

title: Retrieve weather data by municipality name — download_weather_mpio
text: data.frame observed data given municipality

title: Retrieve weather data by municipality name — download_weather_mpio
Group stations — group_stations
text: Groups stations mean observations

title: Group stations — group_stations
text: stations_df data.frame containing stations group tag string tag consulted

title: Group stations — group_stations
text: data.frame two columns containing dates grouped observations

text: lhs value magrittr placeholder. rhs function call using magrittr semantics.

text: result calling rhs(lhs).

title: Retrieve stations that took measurements in the given dates — retrieve_working_stations
code: retrieve_working_stations(   stations,   start_date,   end_date,   frequency,   tag,   group = FALSE )

title: Retrieve stations that took measurements in the given dates — retrieve_working_stations
text: stations vector containing stations codes start_date starting date format "YYYY-MM-DD" end_date end date format "YYYY-MM-DD" frequency aggregation frequency. Can "day", "week","month" "year" tag character containing tag analyze group TRUE, returns one observation mean stations consulted. Default FALSE
